result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul Robert Marshall was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law unless one has already been provided, however, defendant must pay mandatory DNA surcharge. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes: **AMENDED 7-21-2016:  To reflect that the jail time is 90 days.**

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul Robert Marshall

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in custody.  Chris D Steenrod appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defendant's Motion to Amend Sentence.
State does not object and defers to Court.
BTC:  Motion is granted to amend 15CF1384 to 1 year RCJ and 15CF1162 to 90 days RCJ, consec.  Motion for Huber privileges is denied.
Motion to amend motion to modify sentence.

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Parties have reviewed PSI. No additions or corrections noted by parties.

         15CF1384, Ct 2 - 90 days RCJ, consec to 15CF1162 costs, DV surcharge, DNA costs
                             Ct 3 - sent w/held - 3 yrs prob, conc with 15CF1162

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is in compliance with Ch. 950. Upon plea to charge in 15CF1162 and Cts 2 & 3 in 15CF1384, Ct 1 is dismissed outright w/the promise not to reissue and Ct 4 is DRI. The State recommends 15CF1162-I/S WPS - 3 yrs prob; Cts 2 & 3 9 mos RCJ. Defense free to argue.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

BTC: guilty as above. PSI ordered  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 15, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in custody.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense files motion to amend bond. Defense asks that bond be reduced to $500.00 cash and also that SCRAM be removed. The State objects to modification to $500.00. The State agrees to $5000.00 but asks that all conditions remain as previously ordered. The victim is present in court.

BTC: In 15CF1384, Bond modification is granted. Bond to be reduced to $5,000.00. All terms and conditions as previously ordered remain  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.
ATTY Wishau files notice of appointment of counsel.

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Noah Michael Wishau.  Gerad T Dougvillo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $4,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***   No contact with victim store, Wiscon Products, except for restitution purposes.   No contact with the victim, RC (person, property, residence or family).   It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Paul Robert Marshall in custody.  Bridget D. Brave appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 09:00 am.
